p: The three tested essential oils and their main component (1,8-cineole) exhibited anti-QS activity against C. violaceum 026 starter strain. After 24 h incubation, the weakest clear turbid halo zone of 14 mm diameter of violacein inhibition was recorded for the black cardamom and 1,8-cineole at the concentration of 2 mg/disc. The highest diameter of violacein inhibition was noted for the green cardamom about 28 mm and 16 mm with the Ethiopian cardamom essential oil ( Figure 3).
